title: TIMI Risk Score for UA/NSTEMI
desc: The TIMI Risk Score for UA/NSTEMI estimates mortality for patients with unstable angina and non-ST elevation myocardial infarction (MI).

orgreference.text: Antman EM, Cohen M, Bernink PJLM, McCabe CH, Hoacek T, Papuchis G, Mautner B, Corbalan R, Radley D, Braunwald E. The TIMI risk score for unstable angina/non-ST elevation MI: a method for prognostication and therapeutic decision making JAMA. 2000;284(7):835-42.

other_refer.text: Than M, Cullen L, Aldous S, et al. 2-Hour accelerated diagnostic protocol to assess patients with chest pain symptoms using contemporary troponins as the only biomarker: the ADAPT trial. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2012;59(23):2091-8.

data.evidence:
Addition of the selected points:

Variable Points
Age ≥65 1
≥3 CAD risk factors* 1
Known CAD (stenosis ≥50%) 1
ASA use in past 7 days 1
Severe angina (≥2 episodes in 24 hrs) 1
EKG ST changes ≥0.5mm 1
Positive cardiac marker 1

*Risk factors for CAD: Family history of CAD, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, diabetes, or current smoker (thanks to Jeff Geske at Mayo for this update!)

inputs.label_en: Three or more CAD risk factors.
inputs.name: cad_risk_factors
inputs.tips_en: Hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, diabetes, family history of CAD, or current smoker

inputs.label_en: Variation in ST segment on ECG?
inputs.name: ekg_changes
